0.text: If I had a flower for every time I thought of you...I could walk through my garden forever.
0.author: Alfred Tennyson

1.text: Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead.
1.author: Charles Bukowski

2.text: The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it.
2.author: Terry Pratchett

3.text: Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try!
3.author: Dr. Seuss

4.text: What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though.
4.author: J.D. Salinger

5.text: The reason I talk to myself is because I’m the only one whose answers I accept.
5.author: George Carlin

6.text: You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one.
6.author: John Lennon

7.text: I am free of all prejudice. I hate everyone equally.
7.author: W.C. Fields

8.text: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.
8.author: Ayn Rand

9.text: ′Classic′ - a book which people praise and don't read.
9.author: Mark Twain
